meanings.definition: Lacking distinctness or clarity; vague or indistinct.
meanings.sent1: The memory of the dream was hazy in my mind.
meanings.sent2: The view through the foggy window was hazy.
meanings.sent3: Trying to remember what I had for breakfast is like looking through a hazy lens.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was as hazy as trying to see through thick smoke.
meanings.sent5: The hazy outline of the mountain faded into the distance.

meanings.sent1: The hazy morning made it hard to see the road clearly.
meanings.sent2: The valley was hazy with the early morning mist.
meanings.sent3: The hazy sky looked like a painting by a blurry artist.
meanings.sent4: His mind was as hazy as the fog that covered the city.
meanings.sent5: The hazy atmosphere created a mysterious aura around the old castle.
